intro: Senecillis stenocephala, commonly known as the narrow-headed senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in a dense, compact head. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
